subject: Mental Health
title: ADHD: Beyond Distraction
description: A fast breakdown of ADHD: Beyond Distraction for builders.

hook.text: ADHD isn't a lack of attention â€” it's an inability to regulate where attention goes.

buildup.text: It affects about 9 percent of children and involves inattention, hyperactivity, or both.

discovery.text: The prefrontal cortex develops 2 to 3 years slower in children with ADHD.

twist.text: ADHD brains can hyperfocus intensely on interesting tasks while struggling with boring ones.

climax.text: Untreated ADHD increases risk for anxiety, depression, and academic failure.

punchline.text: The brain isn't broken. It's wired differently.
